channel.title: Welcome to CSC 111
channel.description: Recent content on Welcome to CSC 111

item.title: Tutorial 1: Getting Started with Visual Studio Code
item.description: In this tutorial, we will walk you through the installation of Visual Studio Code. Step 1. Install Visual Studio Code Goto VS Code releases, download the appropriate version for your os and archietecture. Download Windows if your os is Windows 8, 10, 11 Download Mac if your os is macOX 10.11+ Open the installer you just download, it will install Visual Studio Code for you by default. After installation finish, you will find the VS Code Application on your Desktop/Lauchpad.

item.title: Tutorial 2: Download and Install Python
item.description: In this tutorial, you will learn how to download and install Python. Step 1: Check Python First step we need to check if Python is already installed on your laptop. If you are working on a cluster, skip this step, we have taken care of everything. We can check it via terminal. First, on your VS Code, click Terminal > New Terminal from top menu to open a new terminal: Below red box is the new terminal we just opened.

item.title: Tutorial 3: Python Hello World
item.description: In this tutorial, you will use Python 3 to create a simple Python “Hello World” program in Visual Studio Code. The Microsoft Python extension will be introduced, through using the Python extension, you make VS Code into a great lightweight Python IDE. Step 1: Install the Python Extension Let’s open VS Code. First, you click the Extension button on the left menu to open the Visual Studio Marketplace. In the Marketplace, search Python.

item.title: Tutorial 4: Remote Development using SSH
item.description: Visual Studio Code allows you to open a remote folder on any remote machine, virtual machine with a running SSH server. As a NC State student, you have access to log into XXX!!! cluster and code on it. Once connected to a sever, you can interact with files and folders anywhere on the remote filesystem. Also, XXX!!! cluster already has Python installed, there is no need to install Python yourselves on remote machine.

item.title: A quick introduction
item.description: Visual Studio Code is a lightweight code editor. The Visual Studio Code is often called as VS Code. It runs both on laptop and cluster. It is available for Windows, macOS and Linux.
